Job Description About the role This is a fantastic opportunity to deploy Arm's cutting-edge software and hardware solutions, working with leading mobile operating systems vendors (OSVs), silicon providers (SiPs), and OEMs.  Arm’s success in mobile markets depends on products that marry hardware and software requirements to form compelling solutions. We are building a team devoted to creating the best possible mobile systems, driving further innovation in the mobile market.  Within this team, we’re looking for a Senior Linux Integration Engineer.  You will work on our cutting-edge technology, deploying it into best-in-class devices. You should be deeply technical and have a proven track record of deploying a range of software and/or hardware technologies. Key to the role is an understanding of hardware design and systems software, the ability to actively identify integration challenges, and then solve them. What will I be accountable for?Work closely with Arm, OSV, and SiP engineering teams to deploy platform technologies, such as CPU, GPU and systems IP, security features, OS features, and device drivers.Tracking partner requests or bug reports and working with Arm software and hardware teams to find solutions.Keeping track of Arm errata and bug reports, and ensuring the latest fixes are deployed at key customers.Clear and effective communication with internal and external teams. Job Requirements What skills, experience, and qualifications do I need?A minimum of 5 years relevant experience as part of a design or customer engineering team. Bachelors (BS) or Masters (MS) in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering - other degrees will be considered with relevant work experiencePassionate about software development and shipping products.Strong knowledge of mobile device and/or System on Chip (SoC) architecture.Strong programming skills in C, C++, and/or Java.Knowledge of one or more of Linux, Android, or Windows internals.Experience with OS kernel or device driver development, back-porting, and/or upstreaming, ideally Linux.Strong analytical skills to determine that complex systems show expected improvements.What are the desired behaviors for this role?
